Name: Sorbetes P

Review Content: I honestly thought this was a historical movie, it was not. The movie is not bad but not great either. It's like they had several writers typing different stories separately and they all gathered one day and picked a scene from each, mashed them together and called it a day. Time travel, a man eating monster, a serial killer, and a chick, they should have added aliens and completed the set.
Name: Am3i0Ys5oFb0hWnsw3fWjSOKt88cKPubWC4NsO8tkkcWmto2FmzfqoHKKcJPFpLcDYSVjcggcPouoOtwnI87iawuPWhkzixBF45F0viJ4FKm

Review Content: "Mallari" is a promising film that delivers on horror with its scary and creepy elements. However, it falls short in its seamless storytelling, feeling convoluted at times. Despite this, the setting and acting are well-executed, and the presence of typical Filipino tropes does not detract from the overall experience.
Name: Ralph O

Review Content: It was a well-crafted movie with a very unpredictable plot. The acting was superb. I was amazed at how good actor Jc Santos is. The Screenwriters were able to capture the exact flavor for the three generations. The Sound and Visual Fx are good. However, the jumpscares were very unnecessary.
